content: Yes, social media can be a complex platform for polling data. The sheer volume of information on these platforms can make it difficult for pollsters to capture accurate data that represents an entire population. Additionally, there are factors such as confirmation bias, echo chambers, and the algorithms used by social media platforms that can exacerbate the biases and cause further discrepancies in polling data. It's important to consider these limitations when interpreting polling results from social media platforms.
